00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the Machine class.
00017 
00018 #ifndef __MACHINE_HPP
00019 #define __MACHINE_HPP
00020 
00021 #include <types.hpp>
00022 #include <data.hpp>
00023 #include <stack.hpp>
00024 #include <state.hpp>
00025 #include <script.hpp>
00026 #include <neighbour.hpp>
00027 #include <neighbourlist.hpp>
00028 #include <instructions.hpp>
00029 #include <machineextension.hpp>
00030 #include <machineid.hpp>
00031 
00032 /// A virtual machine.
00033 /**
00034  * \note This class is \ref extending "extensible".
00035  */
00036 class Machine : public MachineExtension {
00037     
00038     public:
00039         
00040         /// The ID of this Machine.
00041         MachineId id;
00042         
00043         /// The standard stack.
00044         Stack<Data> stack;
00045         
00046         /// The environment stack.
00047         Stack<Data> environment;
00048         
00049         /// The globals.
00050         Stack<Data> globals;
00051         
00052         /// The state variables.
00053         Array<State> state;
00054         
00055         /// The list of all the neighbours.
00056         NeighbourList hood;
00057         
00058     protected:
00059         
00060         /// A pointer to the next instruction.
00061         Address instruction_pointer;
00062         
00063         /// Boolean indicating whether execution (installation or a single run) has finished.
00064         bool is_finished;
00065         
00066         /// A pointer to the Neighbour representing this machine.
00067         Neighbour * this_machine;
00068         
00069         /// The callback stack.
00070         /**
00071          * \see call
00072          * \see retn
00073          */
00074         Stack<Instruction> callbacks;
00075         
00076         /// The current neighbour, when iterating through them.
00077         /**
00078          * Used by the hood instructions when iterating through the hood to let the neighbour-instructions know which neighbour is currently being processed.
00079          */
00080         NeighbourList::iterator current_neighbour;
00081         
00082         friend void Instructions::DEF_VM(Machine &);
00083         friend class HoodInstructions;
00084         
00085     public:
00086         
00087         /// The constructor.
00088         Machine() : instruction_pointer(0), this_machine(hood.add(id)), callbacks(1), current_neighbour(hood.end()) {}
00089         
00090         /// \name Execution control
00091         /// \{
00092             
00093             /// Start an installation script.
00094             /**
00095              * \note This does not execute an the installation script, it only prepares it. Call step() while not finished() to execute it.
00096              * 
00097              * \param script A pointer to the installation script.
00098              */
00099             inline void install(Int8 const * script) {
00100                 is_finished = false;
00101                 jump(Address(script));
00102                 callbacks.push(0);
00103             }
00104             
00105             /// Start a single run.
00106             /**
00107              * \note This does not execute an entire run, it only prepares it. Call step() while not finished() to execute it.
00108              */
00109             inline void run() {
00110                 is_finished = false;
00111                 call(instruction_pointer);
00112                 for(size_t i = 0; i < state.size(); i++){
00113                     if (!state[i].is_executed) state[i].data.reset();
00114                     state[i].is_executed = false;
00115                 }
00116             }
00117             
00118             /// Execute the next instruction.
00119             /**
00120              * \note Do not use this function when already finished().
00121              */
00122             inline void step() {
00123                 execute(instructions[nextInt8()]);
00124             }
00125             
00126             /// Check whether the running script (installation or a single run) has finished (true) or not (false).
00127             inline bool finished() {
00128                 return callbacks.empty();
00129             }
00130             
00131         /// \}
00132         
00133         /// \name Control flow
00134         /// \{
00135             
00136             /// Jump to another address.
00137             /**
00138              * \param address The address to jump to.
00139              */
00140             inline void jump(Address address) {
00141                 instruction_pointer = address;
00142             }
00143             
00144             /// Advance the instruction pointer.
00145             /**
00146              * \param distance The number of bytes to skip.
00147              */
00148             inline void skip(Size distance) {
00149                 instruction_pointer += distance;
00150             }
00151             
00152             /// Call a function.
00153             /**
00154              * \param address The address of the first instruction of the function.
00155              * \param callback Called when the function returns.
00156              */
00157             inline void call(Address address, Instruction callback = 0) {
00158                 callbacks.push(callback);
00159                 stack.push(instruction_pointer);
00160                 jump(address);
00161             }
00162             
00163             /// Return from a function.
00164             /**
00165              * If the corresponding call (if any) registered a callback, it will be called.
00166              * 
00167              * \see Instructions::RET
00168              */
00169             inline void retn() {
00170                 Instruction callback = callbacks.pop();
00171                 Data result = stack.pop();
00172                 jump(stack.popAddress());
00173                 if (!callbacks.empty() || callback) stack.push(result);
00174                 if (callback) callback(*this);
00175             }
00176             
00177             /// Get the current address (instruction pointer).
00178             inline Address currentAddress() const {
00179                 return instruction_pointer;
00180             }
00181             
00182             /// Get the callback depth.
00183             /**
00184              * Usually 1, but higher inside instructions such as \ref Instructions::INIT_FEEDBACK "INIT_FEEDBACK" or \ref Instructions::TUP_MAP "TUP_MAP".
00185              */
00186             inline Counter depth() const {
00187                 return callbacks.size();
00188             }
00189             
00190         /// \}
00191         
00192         /// \name Low level
00193         /// \{
00194             
00195             /// Read the next byte as an unsigned 8-bit integer.
00196             inline Int8 nextInt8() {
00197                 return *instruction_pointer++;
00198             }
00199             
00200             /// Read the next two bytes as an unsigned 16-bit integer (big endian).
00201             inline Int16 nextInt16() {
00202                 Int16 data  = static_cast<Int16>(nextInt8()) << 8;
00203                       data += nextInt8();
00204                 return data;
00205             }
00206             
00207             /// Execute an instruction.
00208             /**
00209              * \param instruction The Instruction to execute.
00210              * 
00211              * \see Instructions
00212              */
00213             inline void execute(Instruction instruction) {
00214                 instruction(*this);
00215             }
00216             
00217         /// \}
00218         
00219         /// \name Neighbour methods
00220         /// \{
00221             
00222             /// Get the current neighbour, when iterating through them.
00223             /**
00224              * Used by the hood instructions when iterating through the hood to let the neighbour-instructions know which neighbour is currently being processed.
00225              */
00226             inline Neighbour & currentNeighbour() {
00227                 return *current_neighbour;
00228             }
00229             
00230             /// Get the Neighbour representing this machine.
00231             inline Neighbour & thisMachine() {
00232                 return *this_machine;
00233             }
00234             
00235         /// \}
00236 };
00237 
00238 #endif
